titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William C. Kingsley and John B. Woodward engrossed resolutions 1989.005
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-21T14:42-0500

did.unittitle: William C. Kingsley and John B. Woodward engrossed resolutions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Three engrossed resolutions in honor of William C. Kingsley, dating from 1885, and three engrossed resolutions in honor of General John B. Woodward, dating from 1896.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: William C. Kingsley (1833-1885) was a businessman, politican, and engineer who served as a member of the Board of Trustees, Vice-President, and President of the New York Bridge Company, the firm that oversaw the building of the Brooklyn Bridge.

John B. Woodward (1835-1896) was a Brooklyn businessman involved in the import-export trade in South America. He also served in the Brooklyn-based 13th Regiment of the New York National Guard, and was a mayoral candidate in Brooklyn in 1885.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1989.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); William C. Kingsley and John B. Woodward engrossed resolutions, 1989.005, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
